snippet: Three young immigrants who grew up in the United States and call themselves Dreamers reunited at a border fence in Arizona with their parents, who had been deported.
abstract: Group of young immigrants who grew up in United States without legal status, calling themselves Dreamers, reunite at border fence in Arizona with their deported parents to dramatize support for bill in Senate to overhaul immigration system.

byline.original: By REBEKAH ZEMANSKY and JULIA PRESTON
byline.contributor: Rebekah Zemansky reported from Nogales, and Julia Preston from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Three young immigrants who grew up in the United States and call themselves Dreamers reunited at a border fence in Arizona with their parents, who had been deported.

headline.seo: Divided Immigrant Families Reach Beyond Barriers
headline.main: Immigrants Reach Beyond a Legal Barrier for a Reunion
headline.print_headline: Immigrants Reach Beyond a Legal Barrier
